title: Make area names clickable with property listing navigation

requirements.text: Convert all area names displayed in the Featured Properties section (e.g., 'Gulshan', 'Banani', 'Dhanmondi') into clickable links that navigate users to filtered property listings for that specific area

quotes: Each area name should link to the relevant section or page that displays properties in that area
Example: 'Gulshan' → property listings in Gulshan; 'Banani' → property listings in Banani, etc.

acceptanceCriteria: Area names in property cards are rendered as clickable links or buttons
Clicking an area name navigates to a filtered view showing only properties in that area
Navigation works on both desktop and mobile devices

requirements.text: Create a dynamic area landing page or filterable section that displays property listings filtered by the selected area name, with URL routing support for direct access to area-specific property views

quotes: If a dedicated page for an area does not exist, create a dynamic section or landing page for it
The links should open on click and navigate users to that area's property listings without confusion

acceptanceCriteria: A dedicated route or section exists for each area (e.g., /properties/gulshan or #gulshan)
The area landing page displays all properties matching that area
URL is bookmarkable and shareable for direct access to area-specific listings
Navigation is clear and users can easily return to the main property listing view

requirements.text: Style clickable area name links with clear visual indicators including hover underline, distinct color (navy blue or gold from STATEGURD brand palette), and sufficient contrast to indicate interactivity

quotes: Ensure the clickable text is styled clearly (e.g., underline on hover, bold color)
The design must keep the STATEGURD branding consistent and remain easy to navigate

acceptanceCriteria: Area name links use navy blue or gold color from the existing brand palette
Links display an underline on hover state
Links have sufficient color contrast for accessibility
Visual styling is consistent across desktop and mobile views

requirements.text: Implement smooth scroll behavior or page transitions when navigating between the main property listing view and area-specific filtered views to enhance user experience

quotes: Add smooth scroll or page transition for better user experience

acceptanceCriteria: Navigation to area-specific views includes smooth scroll or fade transition animation
Transition duration is between 300-600ms for optimal UX
Transitions work consistently on both desktop and mobile devices

constraints: Maintain the existing STATEGURD navy blue, gold, and white color palette
Preserve the professional, trust-building aesthetic throughout the navigation experience
Do not modify the backend/main.mo file or backend schema
Keep the navigation simple and intuitive without complex multi-level routing
nonGoals: Backend property filtering or database queries
User authentication or saved area preferences
Advanced search or filter features beyond area-based filtering
